post.body: Well, zeronet has changed quite a bit since I was last here.
I picked up a bunch of old transistors. Not sure what I'm going to do with them!
What's everyone think of Mikrotik equipment? I like it, but the wireless stuff hates certain products.

There's a commercial bakery near where I work. They make things like sandwich buns and singe-serve fruit pies. You can always tell what they are baking, and I'd love to go over there and purchase some pies hot off the line, they probably taste a lot better than the ones that sit around for a while...
Been a while since I've been here, what's new?
Here's an old pic of me and RTHawk at Anthrocon 2001. Hard to believe it was 18 years ago...first time in suit, so awkward.
Seriously, where do all these cables come from?

comment.body: @Sick: It's the griffin from Sprecher Root Beer.
@ulrichard: I think I need more transistors for that.

My little Canon Point n Shoot does the same thing, it creates a local wi-if network that you connect to with a proprietary piece of software. Surprisingly, the Android version works ok, but I've never been able to get the iOS version to work. I'm not sure why they just don't use bluetooth, it seems like it would be a much better option to just push the pictures to other enabled devices.

I do remember way back when with Blackberry devices, those did it right. Want to transfer a video from one to another? Just bluetooth.
